newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel oil returns slowly from Easter break.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel oil returns slowly from Easter break.

text.p: NWE high sulphur barge prices softened on Tuesday in a market that gained momentum later in the day. Other grades were very quiet.
High sulphur barges traded at $85 and $86 fob ARA, off slightly from last Thursday. Bunker demand picked up with enquiries for 40,000 tonnes of material reported.
Some majors were seen short and unable to meet demand.
"If we see bullish API figures from the States it will give prices a kick upwards," said one trader. "Right now there are more buyers than sellers."
Low sulphur barge markets were stagnant.
Big sellers were unwilling to move from offers of slightly below $98 fob ARA and buyers pegged bids at $96.
Cargo markets were very quiet with traders in a hesitant post-Easter mood and unsure of how far the fall in crude will go. Prices were notionally steady.
A large cargo of low sulphur cracked was rumoured being fixed for the Far East from northern Europe, tightening the market, but this could not be confirmed.
